intro: Pavetta rothiana, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Pavetta rothiana is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
